text:
How have folks contracted out sales enablement/bofu content work? I’m at a Series A and have most of my marketing spend/team directed at TOFU/awareness, and marketing ops (measurement/tracking). I won’t be in a position to hire FT for the near term.

Specifically, I envision we will need content support as we move further towards a self-serve product, andI  have a couple channel partnerships that need support. We don’t have a product leader at the moment. While I have a marketing manager freelancer and a writer — neither seems like a fit for working on this type of content. And if I am being honest, it is not really where my interest lies either.

Does anyone have experience with this sort of situation or suggestions on what you've done when your internal resources are limited?

elements.text:

Specifically, I envision we will need content support as we move further towards a self-serve product, andI  have a couple channel partnerships that need support. We don’t have a product leader at the moment. While I have a marketing manager freelancer and a writer — neither seems like a fit for working on this type of content. And if I am being honest, it is not really where my interest lies either.

Does anyone have experience with this sort of situation or suggestions on what you've done when your internal resources are limited?

text: I don’t have an answer, but am in a similar boat even with a larger in-house team--our goals all focus on brand awareness and customer acquisition through owned channels, but as channel, partner and affiliate efforts are taking off on the sales side we’re getting a much higher volume of requests for bottom of funnel and product education collateral, as well as partner marketing collateral. We support a limited number currently and ensure they align with our overall content/marketing goals, but there is definitely demand for more of a services and partner content support function. Eager to hear how others have approached this!

elements.text: I don’t have an answer, but am in a similar boat even with a larger in-house team--our goals all focus on brand awareness and customer acquisition through owned channels, but as channel, partner and affiliate efforts are taking off on the sales side we’re getting a much higher volume of requests for bottom of funnel and product education collateral, as well as partner marketing collateral. We support a limited number currently and ensure they align with our overall content/marketing goals, but there is definitely demand for more of a services and partner content support function. Eager to hear how others have approached this!

text:
Personally I think it’s much harder to outsource BOFU/SE content than TOFU/awareness content. It requires a certain closeness with your product as well as your sales team.

That being said, I think a smart marketer might be able to either 1) adapt internal/customer-facing documentation and content to serve prospects later in the funnel or 2) work with more technical roles like sales engineers/solutions architects as SMEs to understand what’s required in the buying process and can be content-ized. Maybe the right agency or consultant could do this as well, although I’m more skeptical of that. It would probably need to be someone very familiar with your space, maybe a former analyst or practitioner, even a former customer.
